intent_atoms.description: Provide deterministic corrupt fixtures for testing header decoding failures, truncated payloads, and traversal guard triggers in tolerant parsing.

Corrupt fixtures must be located under Fixtures/Corrupt/, catalogued in Documentation/FixtureCatalog/corrupt-fixtures.json with corruption patterns, affected boxes, expected ParseIssue codes, and smoke-test hints.
generate_fixtures.py should emit the corrupt corpus alongside existing synthetic text fixtures to allow reproducible regeneration.
CorruptFixtureCorpusTests must validate manifest structure and confirm tolerant parsing processes smoke fixtures while recording documented issues.
The system must always maintain a consistent fixture catalog and manifest structure for corrupt fixtures.
Add deterministic corrupt fixtures under Fixtures/Corrupt/ and integrate them into the generated corpus via generate_fixtures.py.

functional_units.name: Deterministic Corrupt Fixtures
functional_units.description: Provides a set of reproducible corrupt data fixtures covering header decoding failures, truncated payloads, and traversal guard triggers for tolerant parsing.

functional_units.name: Corrupt Fixture Catalog Documentation
functional_units.description: Documents corruption patterns, affected boxes, and expected ParseIssue codes with smoke-test hints in corrupt-fixtures.json.

functional_units.name: Fixture Generation Extension
functional_units.description: Extends generate_fixtures.py to emit the corrupt corpus alongside existing synthetic text fixtures for reproducible regeneration.

functional_units.name: Corrupt Fixture Corpus Tests
functional_units.description: Validates manifest structure and ensures tolerant parsing processes smoke fixtures while recording documented issues.

functional_units.name: Updated Fixture Catalog Documentation Workflow
functional_units.description: Describes the corrupt corpus workflow, references the new manifest and tests in the fixture catalog documentation.
